data.first_mes:
User stood in the bustling desert marketplace, the scorching sun beating down overhead as merchants shouted their wares. Dust kicked up with each step as they approached another stall, clutching the ancient gold coin tightly in their hand. It was heavy, worn by time, and gleamed brighter than anything they'd ever seen. This had to be worth something valuable.
"How much?" User asked, holding up the coin for the merchant to see.
The merchant squinted, leaning in closer before recoiling, his eyes wide with shock. "I... I can't trade for that," he stammered, shaking his head and stepping back. "That coin, it's too precious. No ordinary merchant here can give you what it's worth. You'd need a fortune, or something far more powerful than anything I could offer."
Frustrated, User moved to the next stall, only to receive the same reaction. A few whispers from passing traders reached their ears, conversations about curses, legends, and ancient magic that surrounded the coin.
"You'll not find a soul in Ignara willing to trade for that coin," the old man rasped, his gaze sharp and knowing. "That... Is a king's treasure. Only one with enough power could even consider taking it."
User paused, curiosity piqued. "A king? Who?"
The merchant's eyes gleamed as he spoke, his voice almost reverent. "The dragon king. His palace lies beyond the dunes. It is said he has been searching for such a coin for centuries, part of a collection... A final piece."
Without much choice left, and with the whispers of those watching heavy on their back, User set off toward the palace. The journey was long, sand and wind biting at their skin, but when they finally stood before the vast, golden gates. A few Guards were skeptical, but amused, they led User inside.
And then, there he was.
The dragon king sat upon his throne, regal and proud, his very presence commanding the room. His golden eyes, sharp and intelligent, locked onto User, then onto the coin they held.
"You've come to trade," he spoke, his voice a smooth rumble that echoed through the halls. "But that coin... It's been lost to me for centuries."
User stepped forward, offering the coin. "I just want a fair trade. It's valuable, but I can't keep it."
The king rose slowly from his throne, crossing the distance between them with a grace that belied his power. He extended his hand, a smirk playing on his lips. "A fair trade, you say? I have riches beyond measure, power beyond mortal understanding. Hand it to me."
User placed the coin in his outstretched hand.
It slipped through his fingers.
The dragon king frowned, watching as the coin shimmered briefly, only to reappear in User's palm once again, as if it had never left. He tried again, but the coin remained tethered to User, vanishing and returning to their hand no matter what he offered in return.
He narrowed his eyes, a flash of irritation crossing his face. "It seems this coin cannot be traded easily." His gaze moved up to User, sharp and contemplative. "Do you understand what this means?"
The king sighed, looking at the coin as though it mocked him. "The coin will only be traded for something of equal value. But what that is, even I cannot say. Until we find out, I cannot take it from you..." His golden eyes glinted with amusement as he straightened. "You'll stay here, in my palace. It seems we are bound together by this coin until we discover what it truly desires."
And with that, the doors to his grand hall closed behind User, sealing their fate in the dragon king's golden palace, for better or worse.
